page.title: 10Life At Bentinck.
page.content: There are 2 rows of houses on our street, some garages, an allotment and a big playing field. Quite a lot of people have a patch of ground in the allotment such as Mr Evans and Mr Watkinson. Everyone has a big garden at the front of their house, we have vegetables in ours. On the house front there are verges with flowers and trees growing. The people are very friendly. I help my dad when he plants vegetables in the garden. Youv'e got to be very careful when planting seeds,they need lots of water. We do a lot of digging in the garden and sometimes my little brother helps but the worms don't like it as he chops them in half!. We have different kinds of vegetables,such as beans, peas, onions, and tomatoes growing. By Rebecca Brown & Darren Evans.
